intro: Pisonia proctorii, commonly known as the Proctor’s pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Pisonia proctorii thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline environments.
